snippet: Teachers in Idaho and elsewhere have been in revolt over policy makers thrusting technology into classrooms and shifting money to unproven teaching methods.
abstract: Teachers in Idaho are in revolt over a new law that requires all high school students to take some online classes to graduate, a move that is being funded by shifting tens of millions of dollars away from salaries for teachers and administrators; tension in Idaho reflects a debate that is taking place across the country as policymakers thrust technology into classrooms and teachers balk at having money rerouted to unproven teaching methods; (Series: Grading the Digital School).
lead_paragraph: Teachers in Idaho and elsewhere have been in revolt over policy makers thrusting technology into classrooms and shifting money to unproven teaching methods.

headline.seo: Idaho Teachers Fight a Reliance on Computers
headline.main: Teachers Resist High-Tech Push in Idaho Schools
